thread.title: ‘Bad blood’ between television co-stars throughout the years
thread.title_full: ‘Bad blood’ between television co-stars throughout the years - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: ‘Bad blood’ between television co-stars throughout the years
text:
EIKE SCHROTER/CBS 'The Good Wife' co-stars Archie Panjabi (left) and Julianna Margulies have been rumored to dislike one another off the set of the popular television series. There have been rumors of discontent between “The Good Wife” television co-stars Julianna Margulies and Archie Panjabi have had for a handful of years.
Their off-set feud was apparently resurrected on Oct. 4, when Margulies took to the New Yorker Festival stage to dispel past gossip.
During the three-day arts event, Margulies explained that her “Good Wife” co-star did not show up to film their last scene together due to Panjabi’s commitment to filming for another television show, “The Fall.”
Margulies also expressed that she “ went along with whatever (co-creator Robert King) asked me to do .”
On Monday, Panjabi responded on Twitter , saying there was nothing true to Margulies’ tale.
The pair’s behind-the-scenes feud is just one on a long list in Tinseltown history.
Here are five of the most popular supposed television co-star feuds:
MICHAEL CARONNA/REUTERS 'Sex and the City' cast members Sarah Jessica Parker (left) and Kim Cattrall were reportedly not always the best of friends behind the scenes of the hit show. Kim Cattrall vs. Sarah Jessica Parker
“Sex and the City” stars Kim Cattrall and Sarah Jessica Parker portrayed lifelong best friends — Samantha Jones and Carrie Bradshaw — on the celebrated hit television series.
But their on-screen chemistry did not translate into real-life happiness for the two away from the cameras .
With reports of diva behavior and unequal salaries, co-star Cynthia Nixon even alluded that the show’s leading ladies were not immune to having an argument every now and then.
“It hasn’t always been smooth sailing, but the idea that we’re somehow adversarial is ludicrous,” she told Marie Claire Magazine in 2010.
Ron Tom/AP Likeable Hollywood actor Will Smith did not have a fan in co-star Janet Hubert during their time on 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air.' Will Smith vs. Janet Hubert
In 2011, actress Janet Hubert — better known as the original Aunt Viv on the 1990s syndicated television show “Fresh Prince of Bel Air” — called Hollywood actor Will Smith an a e and an egomaniac .
However, it was Hubert’s 2009 memoir, “ Perfection Is Not a Sitcom Mom ,” that she first detailed her dislike for the “Suicide Squad” actor in print.
The working actress has said that she would attend a “Fresh Prince of Bel Air” reunion, should the opportunity present itself.
In the 1990s, actress and producer Shannen Doherty was a teen idol, thanks to her role as Brenda Walsh on the Fox television series, 'Beverly Hills, 90210.' Shannen Doherty vs. Everyone
Before “The O.C.” and “One Tree Hill,” there was “Beverly Hills, 90210.”
The prominent teen television drama remained on the air for 10 seasons.
But one of its most notorious stars, Shannen Doherty, was soon fired playing the character Brenda Walsh.
Suggestions of fights with fellow co-stars and being difficult to work with led to Doherty’s demise on the hit program.
Doherty soon found herself starring in another Aaron Spelling-produced drama, “Charmed.”
The actress was ousted from this series as well, as hints of “ rough days ” with her co-stars — actresses Alyssa Milano and Holly Marie Combs — surfaced in an interview between Milano and Bravo late night talk show host, Andy Cohen.
Larry Busacca/Getty Images Pop singing sensation Ariana Grande starred in another Nickelodeon teen sitcom titled 'Sam & Cat.' Enlarge D Dipasupil/Getty Images for Extra Actress Victoria Justice was rumored to have bullied 'Victorious' co-star Ariana Grande off-set. Enlarge Actress Victoria Justice was rumored to have bullied 'Victorious' co-star Ariana Grande off the set of the Nickelodeon hit show.
Ariana Grande vs. Victoria Justice
Nickelodeon’s “Victorious” stars Ariana Grande and Victoria Justice were bosom buddies Cat Valentine and Tori Vega on the teen sitcom.
Away from the bright stage lights, Grande and Justice were rumored to being teen queen rivals .
In a 2013 issue of Seventeen magazine, Grande stated that she was bullied on the set of “Victorious.”
The bully in question was reported to be her co-star Victoria Justice.
However, Justice sat down with journalist Meredith Viera on her talk show to give a final answer to the question all “Victorious” fans wanted to know.
“Hopefully, now she’s talked about it, I’ve talked about it, there is no feud,” the singer and actress told Viera.
Nicki Minaj vs. Mariah Carey
Reality television’s “American Idol” fast became a ticket to fame and success for singing hopefuls at the mercy of veteran music industry judges.
When the brutally honest talent judge and music business juggernaut Simon Cowell left the show in 2010, a revolving door of other tamer judges followed.
Then pop superstar Mariah Carey and rapper Nicki Minaj joined the “American Idol” cast for its 12th season.
This would be their first and last season as judging co-stars.
A volatite rift between the two grew to epic proportions, as allegations of videotaped arguments and threats of violence ensued.
Kevin Winter/Getty Images Recording artist Mariah Carey and rapper Nicki Minaj were supposedly not fans of each other while working as talent judges on the reality television singing series, 'American Idol.'
